question: What are assassin bugs?
ideal_answer: The family Reduviidae (Hemiptera: Heteroptera), or assassin bugs, is among the most diverse families of the true bugs, with more than 6,000 species.

snippets.text: The complete mitochondrial genome of an assassin bug Peirates arcuatus (Hemiptera: Reduviidae).
First complete mitochondrial genome sequence from the tribelocephaline assassin bugs (Hemiptera: Reduviidae).
The complete mitochondrial genome (mitogenome) of Opistoplatys sp. was determined, which was the first representation from the assassin bug subfamily Tribelocephalinae.
The family Reduviidae (Hemiptera: Heteroptera), or assassin bugs, is among the most diverse families of the true bugs, with more than 6,000 species.
Comparative mitogenomics of the assassin bug genus Peirates (Hemiptera: Reduviidae: Peiratinae)
